intro: Rapuntium dortmanna, commonly known as the Dormann's cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has pinnately lobed leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hair. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Rapuntium dortmanna is typically found at high altitudes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
